title: aobench hangs when compiled with -C target-cpu=native

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

body:
I've ported ISPC ambient occlusion benchmark to use `std::simd` portable vector types here: https://github.com/gnzlbg/aobench

Running the binary with

```
cargo run --release -- 800 600 --algo vector
```

works fine. However, using:

```
RUSTFLAGS="-C target-cpu=native" cargo run --release -- 800 600 --algo vector
```

the binary hangs in `std::sys::unix::stack_overflow::imp::signal_handler::ha55d20b1873e8199`:

![screen shot 2018-06-06 at 11 43 36](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/904614/41030596-f49dc68e-697e-11e8-8e71-3f44aaa3909e.png)

This happens on a MacBook Air (13-inch, Mid 2012) with a 1.8 GHz Intel Core i5. The following fails to compile

```
RUSTFLAGS="-C target-cpu=hawell" cargo run --release -- 800 600 --algo vector
```

and the following

```
RUSTFLAGS="-C target-cpu=help" cargo run --release -- 800 600 --algo vector
```

fails to compile with: 

```
error: malformed cfg value or key/value pair: `Available CPUs for this target:`
```
(no cpus listed)
